title: Converting old fonts.
content: Hi all I have some old Postscript fonts on an OS 9.2 macintosh computer that I need to move onto a brand new OSX machine. The fonts are postscript fonts organized by adobe font suitcases. For some reason whenever I move them over to the new machine, OSX font book refuses to recognize them. Does anyone know why or have any suggestions for what to do?
author: ThroneMonkey

comments.content:
You need to move the "printer" fonts as well, not just the suitcases:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203093858im_/http:/typophile.com/files/fru_4472.png)
  
Only "Frutiger" is a screen font (or a "suitcase"), all others are printer fonts. And, they all look the same under OSX!

Another matter: the screenfonts need to be separate â€” in other words: not bundled in one suitcase. AND the family links have to be resolved.

In the screenshot above there are 9 printerfonts and one suitcase with probably all the corresponding screenfonts. You would want to have nine separate screenfonts.

. . .  
Bert Vanderveen BNO

Bert, can you elaborate upon why you believe it necessary to have all separate screen fonts? I have several machines, all on OS X since 10.1 (currently 10.5.6) and have absolutely no problems with bundled (suitcased) screen fonts.

I don't use Font Book though; I use Suitcase.
